00047 extern int global_max_hosts;
00048 extern int global_max_checks;

00050 
00056 int
00057 common (l1, l2)
00058      struct arglist *l1, *l2;
00059 {
00060   struct arglist *l2_start = l2;
00061   if (!l1 || !l2)
00062     {
00063       return 0;
00064     }
00065   while (l1->next != NULL)
00066     {
00067       l2 = l2_start;
00068       while (l2->next != NULL)
00069         {
00070           if (strcmp (l1->name, l2->name) == 0)
00071             return 1;
00072           l2 = l2->next;
00073         }
00074       l1 = l1->next;
00075     }
00076   return 0;
00077 }
00078 
00083 struct arglist *
00084 list2arglist (list)
00085      char *list;
00086 {
00087   struct arglist *ret = emalloc (sizeof (struct arglist));
00088   char *t;
00089 
00090   if (!list)
00091     {
00092       efree (&ret);
00093       return ret;
00094     }
00095 
00096 
00097   while ((t = strchr (list, ',')) != NULL)
00098     {
00099       t[0] = 0;
00100       while (list[0] == ' ')
00101         list++;
00102       if (list[0] != '\0')
00103         {
00104           arg_add_value (ret, list, ARG_INT, 0, (void *) 1);
00105         }
00106       list = t + 1;
00107     }
00108 
00109   while (list[0] == ' ')
00110     list++;
00111   if (list[0] != '\0')
00112     {
00113       arg_add_value (ret, list, ARG_INT, 0, (void *) 1);
00114     }
00115   return ret;
00116 }

00124 int
00125 get_max_hosts_number (preferences)
00126      struct arglist *preferences;
00127 {
00128   int max_hosts;
00129   if (arg_get_value (preferences, "max_hosts"))
00130     {
00131       max_hosts = atoi (arg_get_value (preferences, "max_hosts"));
00132       if (max_hosts <= 0)
00133         {
00134           log_write ("Error ! max_hosts = %d -- check %s\n", max_hosts,
00135                      (char *) arg_get_value (preferences, "config_file"));
00136           max_hosts = global_max_hosts;
00137         }
00138       else if (max_hosts > global_max_hosts)
00139         {
00140           log_write ("Client tried to raise the maximum hosts number - %d. Using %d. Change 'max_hosts' in openvassd.conf if \
00141 you believe this is incorrect\n", max_hosts,
00142                      global_max_hosts);
00143           max_hosts = global_max_hosts;
00144         }
00145     }
00146   else
00147     max_hosts = global_max_hosts;
00148   return (max_hosts);
00149 }
00150 
00155 int
00156 get_max_checks_number (preferences)
00157      struct arglist *preferences;
00158 {
00159   int max_checks;
00160   if (arg_get_value (preferences, "max_checks"))
00161     {
00162       max_checks = atoi (arg_get_value (preferences, "max_checks"));
00163       if (max_checks <= 0)
00164         {
00165           log_write ("Error ! max_hosts = %d -- check %s\n", max_checks,
00166                      (char *) arg_get_value (preferences, "config_file"));
00167           max_checks = global_max_checks;
00168         }
00169       else if (max_checks > global_max_checks)
00170         {
00171           log_write ("Client tried to raise the maximum checks number - %d. Using %d. Change 'max_checks' in openvassd.conf if \
00172 you believe this is incorrect\n", max_checks,
00173                      global_max_checks);
00174           max_checks = global_max_checks;
00175         }
00176     }
00177   else
00178     max_checks = global_max_checks;
00179   return (max_checks);
00180 }

00186 int
00187 get_active_plugins_number (struct arglist *plugins)
00188 {
00189   int num = 0;
00190 
00191   if (plugins != NULL)
00192     while (plugins->next != NULL)
00193       {
00194         if (plug_get_launch (plugins->value) != LAUNCH_DISABLED)
00195           num++;
00196         plugins = plugins->next;
00197       }
00198 
00199   return num;
00200 }

00207 int
00208 process_alive (pid_t pid)
00209 {
00210   int i, ret;
00211   if (pid == 0)
00212     return 0;
00213 
00214   for (i = 0, ret = 1; (i < 10) && (ret > 0); i++)
00215     ret = waitpid (pid, NULL, WNOHANG);
00216 
00217   return kill (pid, 0) == 0;
00218 }

00225 int
00226 is_client_present (soc)
00227      int soc;
00228 {
00229   fd_set rd;
00230   struct timeval tv;
00231   int m;
00232   int e;
00233 
00234   stream_zero (&rd);
00235   m = stream_set (soc, &rd);
00236 again:
00237   tv.tv_sec = 2;
00238   tv.tv_usec = 0;
00239   e = select (m + 1, &rd, NULL, NULL, &tv);
00240   if (e < 0 && errno == EINTR)
00241     goto again;
00242 
00243   if (e > 0)
00244     {
00245       int len = data_left (openvas_get_socket_from_connection (soc));
00246       if (!len)
00247         {
00248           log_write ("Communication closed by client\n");
00249           return 0;
00250         }
00251     }
00252   return 1;
00253 }
00254 
00255 int
00256 data_left (soc)
00257      int soc;
00258 {
00259   int data = 0;
00260   ioctl (soc, FIONREAD, &data);
00261   return data;
00262 }
00263 
00264 void
00265 wait_for_children1 ()
00266 {
00267   int e, n = 0;
00268   do
00269     {
00270       errno = 0;
00271       e = waitpid (-1, NULL, WNOHANG);
00272       n++;
00273     }
00274   while ((e > 0 || errno == EINTR) && n < 20);
00275 }
00276 
00277 /*
00278  * @brief Checks if a provided preference is scanner-only and can't be
00279  * read/written by the client.
00280  *
00281  * @return 1 if pref is scanner-only, 0 otherwise.
00282  */
00283 int
00284 is_scanner_only_pref (const char *pref)
00285 {
00286   if (pref == NULL)
00287     return 0;
00288   if (!strcmp (pref, "logfile") || !strcmp (pref, "config_file")
00289       || !strcmp (pref, "plugins_folder")
00290       || !strcmp (pref, "dumpfile")
00291       || !strcmp (pref, "negot_timeout")
00292       || !strcmp (pref, "force_pubkey_auth")
00293       || !strcmp (pref, "log_while_attack")
00294       || !strcmp (pref, "ca_file") || !strcmp (pref, "key_file")
00295       || !strcmp (pref, "cert_file") || !strcmp (pref, "be_nice")
00296       || !strcmp (pref, "log_plugins_name_at_load")
00297       || !strcmp (pref, "nasl_no_signature_check")
00298       /* Preferences starting with sys_ are scanner-side only. */
00299       || !strncmp (pref, "sys_", 4))
00300     return 1;
00301   return 0;
00302 }
